alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Greensville; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince George; Sussex; Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 7:39PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of Chesterfield, north central Greensville, northeastern Lunenburg, Nottoway, western Prince George, southwestern Sussex, Dinwiddie, eastern Amelia and northern Brunswick Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 830 PM EST... At 738 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Chula to near Crewe to near Rehoboth. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, Blackstone, Crewe, Victoria, Kenbridge, McKenney, Moseley, Chester, Amelia Courthouse, Mannboro, Fort Lee, Purdy, Virginia State University, Nottoway, Lunenburg, Jarratt and Alberta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Greensville; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince George; Sussex; Western Chesterfield
